text: Triggering of HLA-DR antigens differentially modulates <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release by B cells at distinct stage of maturation .

text: Triggering of HLA class II antigens by the anti-HLA-DR monoclonal antibody ( mAb ) L243 significantly ( P < 0.05 ) and differentially enhanced the release of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) by the non-Hodgkin 's lymphoma cells Ri-I , Ci-I , and Sc-I , which are at a distinct stage of B-cell differentiation , and by the more mature Burkitt lymphoma cell Raji ; in contrast , it did not induce <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release by the pre-B leukemia cells Nalm-6 and BV173 .

text: <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release peaked at 24 h and decreased thereafter , and it was dose dependent and preceded by an increase of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA detectable after 3 h of stimulation with mAb L243 .

text: Secreted <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediated the enhancement of nuclear factor kappa B ( NF-kappa B ) and activator protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) binding activity ; in fact , the triggering of HLA-DR antigens in the presence of antihuman <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - neutralizing antibodies did not upregulate NF-kappa B and AP-1 .

In contrast , released <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was not responsible for the homotypic aggregation of Ri-I , Ci-I , Sc-I , and Raji cells induced by mAb L243 , and it did not affect the proliferation of B cells investigated .

Altogether , our data demonstrate that : ( a ) the ability of B cells to release <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> after triggering of HLA-DR antigens depends on their stage of differentiation ; ( b ) levels of released <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> seem to correlate with the stage of B-cell maturation but do not correlate with the amounts of cell surface HLA-DR antigens ; ( c ) secreted <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulates the levels of expression of NF-kappa B and AP-1 by an autocrine loop ; and ( d ) intracellular signals mediating <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> release by B cells are distinct from those regulating homotypic aggregation and proliferation .
